results.content: Shaun is an excellent instructor. I took his Vue.js course and liked it so much that I followed this D3.js course just because Shaun was the instructor.  I already had a fair amount of experience with D3.js so I wasn't expecting to learn too much, but I was wrong. The course is detailed enough so that I now understand a number of the finer points of d3 that I had previously faked myself through by copying code from examples on the web.  Bravo!
results.content_html: Shaun is an excellent instructor. I took his Vue.js course and liked it so much that I followed this D3.js course just because Shaun was the instructor. I already had a fair amount of experience with D3.js so I wasn't expecting to learn too much, but I was wrong. The course is detailed enough so that I now understand a number of the finer points of d3 that I had previously faked myself through by copying code from examples on the web. Bravo!

results.content: Great overview of d3! The course hits on three or four of the different chart visualizations you'll run into the most (chart, line, pie, and hierarchical). The library itself is, of course, even more expansive and I wouldn't have minded to see geospatial/map diagrams also. The course provides a blueprint from which to start (which all courses should do) and it succeeds in doing that.

results.content: Great course to get started with D3! Shaun starts out by showing some of the basics that D3 is built on, but quickly transitions into more complex graphics with D3 and takes the time to touch on underlying JavaScript (particularly ES6) features that are commonplace in D3. He teaches in a quicker, tutorial-type style, but still explains things well. Towards the end of the course you'll often anticipate what's coming next and be able to do portions on your own because he explains both the process and individual actions he's taking while writing code, which helps you really understand what's going on rather than just zombie-typing. Highly recommended!
results.content_html: Great course to get started with D3! Shaun starts out by showing some of the basics that D3 is built on, but quickly transitions into more complex graphics with D3 and takes the time to touch on underlying JavaScript (particularly ES6) features that are commonplace in D3. He teaches in a quicker, tutorial-type style, but still explains things well. Towards the end of the course you'll often anticipate what's coming next and be able to do portions on your own because he explains both the process and individual actions he's taking while writing code, which helps you really understand what's going on rather than just zombie-typing. Highly recommended!

results.content:
Shaun explains concepts very well and does an amazing job of helping you get comfortable with what is largely a really complicated library.

I can only complain about the use of Firebase, since it restricts user freedoms by tying one into a platform that the user can only use, never understand, modify or share modifications of.  I did, however, use Docker + Express + MongoDB to overcome this issue, so it's only a minor problem.
results.content_html:
Shaun explains concepts very well and does an amazing job of helping you get comfortable with what is largely a really complicated library.

I can only complain about the use of Firebase, since it restricts user freedoms by tying one into a platform that the user can only use, never understand, modify or share modifications of. I did, however, use Docker + Express + MongoDB to overcome this issue, so it's only a minor problem.

results.content: Definitely, the breakdown was concise and the explanations were thorough. I'd highly recommend it for anyone interested.
results.content_html: Definitely, the breakdown was concise and the explanations were thorough. I'd highly recommend it for anyone interested.

results.content:
It's a good course if you want to get a decent understanding of d3. Although to me, d3 seems to be a bit more complex to use than it needs to be. 
Shaun teaches well. And his thick British accent is refreshing (I am a Dutch speaker myself). It gives the course a far more casual feel than most others. 
There is one point of critique though. He switches screens and scrolls a bit too fast sometimes. Almost all coding teachers do this. And every time this happens it create a bit of a disconnect. 
I only came across one instructor who says literally before every screen switch.. 'if we swap over to this screen'.. It really does make a difference because as a student you are still processing information.
To end on a positive note. Next to the d3 stuff, Shaun teaches some of the materialize css and gives a link to a free course on that. 
That's just awesome. Basically you get two for the price of one and if you followed this course from start to end you can easily start making your own visualizations with d3.
results.content_html:
It's a good course if you want to get a decent understanding of d3. Although to me, d3 seems to be a bit more complex to use than it needs to be.
Shaun teaches well. And his thick British accent is refreshing (I am a Dutch speaker myself). It gives the course a far more casual feel than most others.
There is one point of critique though. He switches screens and scrolls a bit too fast sometimes. Almost all coding teachers do this. And every time this happens it create a bit of a disconnect.
I only came across one instructor who says literally before every screen switch.. 'if we swap over to this screen'.. It really does make a difference because as a student you are still processing information.
To end on a positive note. Next to the d3 stuff, Shaun teaches some of the materialize css and gives a link to a free course on that.
That's just awesome. Basically you get two for the price of one and if you followed this course from start to end you can easily start making your own visualizations with d3.

Mr. Shaun Pelling is probably one of the best video instructors in the market. The explanations are clear and he uses simplified practical examples.

A great course on this topic, and I would also recommend to subscribe to his youtube channel "The Net Ninja" for any clarifications on related subjects, be it modern javascript, firebase or material css!

@Shaun: Thanks! Money well spent!

results.content:
This course made some advanced JavaScript concepts, and a difficult library with some unfamiliar language, much easier to learn.

For context, I'm a beginner / intermediate JavaScript programmer. I've built 1 full application (a GSuite add-on), 4-5 automations for Google GSuite products that involved backend components w/ an HTML front-end, and dabbled in some other languages that resembled JavaScript. 

The instructor does a good job of teaching you concepts in a logical sequence (e.g. learn this first, because you'll need it before we can do something else that requires this knowledge later). He also did a good job with the extra resources--particularly, he made a GitHub repo available with the code for each lesson as a branch, which I thought was smart and which helped me.

The only two minor improvements I would have liked to have seen were: 
(1) I would have preferred that he implemented some of the more advanced JavaScript moves a bit more slowly. For example, when we refactored code to make it tighter, I would have liked a breakdown that was a bit more comprehensive regarding how the refactoring maintained code integrity. Similarly, when we applied some of the post-ECMA6 scripting ("syntax sugar") techniques, I would have liked those implementations to have a bit more explanation. Perhaps advanced programmers taking this course would find that bothersome, though, so I understand if the instructor is trying to meet the needs of both beginner and advanced programmers.
(2) I would have liked an animated lecture that helped me visualize what d3 is designed to do from a high-level perspective. For example, we learned about d3's use of a "canvas" in the DOM, about attributes, and more, and I think this would have been a good time to teach us what, exactly, d3 is doing, the kind of methods it provides, and why it provides those methods. Just a bit more overview of the library would have been helpful.

Overall, I would certainly recommend this course and I would not hesitate to purchase other courses by this instructor.

He also did a good job with the extra resources--particularly, he made a GitHub repo available with the code for each lesson as a branch, which I thought was smart and which helped me.

The only two minor improvements I would have liked to have seen were:

Just a bit more overview of the library would have been helpful.

results.content: Shaun seems to think like I do so I find his approach and explanations to be exactly what I need.  D3 can be a daunting library to learn but, if you are patient enough to follow him through the ten or so hours of video.  The reward at the end is that you will "get it" (because he's a good teacher) and you'll have a new skill to apply to all sorts of things.  I have four other D3 courses in my library, this one hit the spot for me.

Having someone take the time to walk through and explain how they are doing really saves a lot of time and sanity.  I highly recommend this course to anyone looking to learn about data visualization.

results.content: This course filled in the missing gaps I had about D3. Very clear explanations and enjoyable course. Glad it included ES6 features.
results.content_html: This course filled in the missing gaps I had about D3. Very clear explanations and enjoyable course. Glad it included ES6 features.

results.content: Brilliant as usual. Explains concepts as they’re used and doesn’t over complicate or go off on tangents. Focus is very much on helping you understand.
results.content_html: Brilliant as usual. Explains concepts as they’re used and doesn’t over complicate or go off on tangents. Focus is very much on helping you understand.

results.content: D3 builds abstractions upon abstractions which can easily get you confused. This course navigates those layers of abstractions in such a way that you grasp it, first conceptually, then literally as you code. Internalizing layers of abstraction and quirky syntax takes both conceptual understanding and mind/muscle memory through repetition. This course has both in abundance.
results.content_html: D3 builds abstractions upon abstractions which can easily get you confused. This course navigates those layers of abstractions in such a way that you grasp it, first conceptually, then literally as you code. Internalizing layers of abstraction and quirky syntax takes both conceptual understanding and mind/muscle memory through repetition. This course has both in abundance.

results.content: It's been a very informative and engaging course. Sean is a gifted teacher who explains abstract concepts quite clearly with great presentations. Would like to take more courses from him.
results.content_html: It's been a very informative and engaging course. Sean is a gifted teacher who explains abstract concepts quite clearly with great presentations. Would like to take more courses from him.

results.content: This course was very well-organized and the author did a great job of introducing concepts gradually and building up to more complex examples. Solid intro to D3. You should definitely know at least some JavaScript beforehand. Overall great course.
results.content_html: This course was very well-organized and the author did a great job of introducing concepts gradually and building up to more complex examples. Solid intro to D3. You should definitely know at least some JavaScript beforehand. Overall great course.

results.content: This is making D3 so much clearer. I feel like I am learning the tools I need to go on to make my own awesome visualizations.
results.content_html: This is making D3 so much clearer. I feel like I am learning the tools I need to go on to make my own awesome visualizations.

results.content:
Shaun can create another course about "How to be an instructor on Udemy". The way he teaches is that engaging, and I am thankful that the course had so many project examples.

The only improvement I can suggest would be on the last project. While previewing, we were shown an interactive treemap with animations while we ended up having a treemap without any. Other than that, he is great and I specially appreciate his efforts on his Youtube channel as well.
results.content_html:
Shaun can create another course about "How to be an instructor on Udemy". The way he teaches is that engaging, and I am thankful that the course had so many project examples.

The only improvement I can suggest would be on the last project. While previewing, we were shown an interactive treemap with animations while we ended up having a treemap without any. Other than that, he is great and I specially appreciate his efforts on his Youtube channel as well.

results.content:
Tnank you, Shaun, for this course. I've really enjoyed it, especially because I love data visualisation. Before I thought D3 is a nightmare, but after you explanations I will give another try to dig it. 
Thank you again!

results.content: The instructor did an outstanding job of introducing D3 in this course. The lectures were broken down into concise sections and the concepts were explained very well. The use of Firestore to reflect real-world use of D3 with a database was very helpful to me. Many thanks to Shaun for creating this superb course!!
results.content_html: The instructor did an outstanding job of introducing D3 in this course. The lectures were broken down into concise sections and the concepts were explained very well. The use of Firestore to reflect real-world use of D3 with a database was very helpful to me. Many thanks to Shaun for creating this superb course!!

results.content:
it was a good course, learning D3 and basics of Firestore were easy as the explanation was very simple and in an easy way.
I rate the course based on my confidence after the course completion. I've given 3.5 because I'm somewhat confident working with D3. could have given above 4 if this course would have more focus on D3 basic not just required concepts of d3 of selected charts. as I've to go through d3.js documentation to know about builtin functions like pie(), pack(), linkVertical(), etc. 
anyway, the course is good if you want the crux of D3 and learn a few charts.

Thanks and Regards

I rate the course based on my confidence after the course completion. anyway, the course is good if you want the crux of D3 and learn a few charts.

Thanks and Regards

results.content: Really, enjoyed this course. Shaun is very thorough and skilled at clearly explaining what the important bits of code are actually doing. This series is a great jumping off point to get familiar with D3 and Firebase. I'd recommend it to a friend if they wanted to get started with D3.

results.content: It was a great way to start with D3. The projects were fun to build and each step was easy to follow. Also, the instructor covers some JS concepts that are used throughout this course on the ES6 & Extra section.

results.content:
Excellent course. Very practical. You can straight away apply them in real world. The slides Shaun used to teach has the flavor of data viz and are more artistic and appealing. I would straight away buy any of his extended course on this. Highly recommend this course.

He fixed a format and kept doing the same and by the end of the course I have got all those concepts wired in to my brain so sharply.

Thanks again Shaun for this brilliant course. More power to you.

results.content:
Before beginning this course, I had tried to learn D3.js on a few separate occasions.  This course clarified many things for me.  

At first, I wasn't sure for Firebase would fit into the course.  Ultimately, I thought it was an excellent choice to include Firebase with D3.js.  

I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to get a better understanding about D3.js in 2019.
results.content_html:
Before beginning this course, I had tried to learn D3.js on a few separate occasions. This course clarified many things for me.

At first, I wasn't sure for Firebase would fit into the course. Ultimately, I thought it was an excellent choice to include Firebase with D3.js.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to get a better understanding about D3.js in 2019.

results.content: Was looking for a D3 tutorial that I could integrate with React. Ended up using React the entire time rather than the live-html/site that was recommended. Had to make a few adaptions, but for the most part worked great. The d3 tutorial itself was extremely well taught.
